page.title: 20FINAL WORD FROM BRICKENDON
page.content: These pages have been compiled by the following members of Wormley Women's Institute, Mesdames Butcher, Carter, Clark, Deane, Dunn, Gooding, Hart, Howes, Howard, Oliver, Parsonage, Prosser & White & Miss Parsonage. They wish to acknowledge the valuable help of the residents & employees in the district. They give the final word to a house- wife living in Brickendon, a Bayford W.I. member! She willingly sacrifices many amenities, even the much needed village shop, to enjoy the peaceful rural locality & greatly favours the village Council's policy to preserve the Green Belt. There is a good comm- unity spirit, people with cars quick to help those without, & good support for organised events. Surely life here reflects the W.I. hymn's reference to "this green and pleasant land" ?
